oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: |han≠kass'o (Klein Jantje) (VIII)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Illness, for which the Doctor is called in, believed to be caused by butterflies. The narrator’s personal experience of this. Bushman children not allowed to throw stones at butterflies. By /han≠kass’o (L VIII.-20. 7753-7752. rev. and 7753 rev.). A !gixa (healer) 'snores' the afflicted person and draws the butterfly out, sneezing it out of his or her nostrils afterwards. A healer or 'doctoress' called |xu-an 'snored' lhan≠kass’o's ear and removed butterflies. 1) This story is found in Book VIII-20.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Butterflies and !giten
